channel.title: Joël Roman Ky
channel.description: Recent content on Joël Roman Ky

item.description: Starting new position as Research Engineer at INRIA Nancy within RESIST team, working in PEPR Cloud - SPIREC project.

Our conference paper CATS: Contrastive learning for Anomaly detection in Time series got accepted at 2024 IEEE International Conference on Big Data (BigData), Washington DC, USA, December 15 - December 18, 2024.
Participation at the 27th Conference on Innovation in Clouds, Internet and Networks (ICIN 2024), Paris, France, March 11 - March 14, 2024.

We gave an interview to Orange’s research blog Hello Future on L4S technology for latency improvement in networks, which was used in our demo at the Orange Open Tech Days 2023. The interview can be found here.

Our conference paper Segment Routing for Chaining Micro-Services at Different Programmable Network Levels got accepted at 27th Conference on Innovation in Clouds, Internet and Networks (ICIN 2024), Paris, France, March 11 - March 14, 2024.
Received the Public Prize at the Orange competition Ma thèse en 3 minutes. See the pitch in this video and blog article about that event.

Our demo, titled Low Latency made easy, summarizing our work on improving latency in low-latency applications, conducted as part of the ANR MOSAICO project, was presented at the Orange Open Tech Days in Orange Innovation Châtillon (France), November 28 - November 30, 2023."
Participation at the Tools for Causality School in Autrans-Méaudre-en-Vercors, France from September 24 - September 29, 2023.
Our paper NeurIPS’22 Cross-Domain MetaDL Challenge: Results and lessons learned got accepted at Proceedings of Machine Learning Research (PMLR) NeurIPS 2022 Competitions Track.
Participation at the 28th IEEE Symposium on Computers and Communications (ISCC 2023) in Gammarth, Tunisia from July 9 - July 12, 2023.
Our journal paper ML Models for Detecting QoE Degradation in Low-Latency Applications: A Cloud-Gaming Case Study got accepted at IEEE Transactions on Network and Service Management.

Our conference paper A Hybrid P4/NFV Architecture for Cloud Gaming Traffic Detection with Unsupervised ML got accepted at 28th IEEE Symposium on Computers and Communications (ISCC 2023), Gammarth, Tunisia, July 9 - July 12, 2023.

Our journal paper An Analysis of Cloud Gaming Platforms Behaviour Under Synthetic Network Constraints and Real Cellular Networks Conditions got accepted at Journal of Networking and Systems Management.

item.title: Awards
item.description: Research honors and awards Public prize in Orange competition Ma thèse en 3mn Video Article Prizes at Cross-Domain MetaDL: Any-Way Any-Shot Learning Competition with Novel Datasets from Practical Domains part of NeurIPS 2022 Competition Track. First prize in Meta-Learning league Certificate First prize in New-in-ML league Certificate Second prize in Participants of a Rarely Represented Country league Certificate Best poster and presentation award at the 10th TMA PhD School colocated with Network Traffic Measurement and Analysis Conference (TMA), Enschede, Netherlands, 2022 Certificate High-School awards Best score in National High School Diploma (Baccalauréat Série C in french) 2016, Ouagadougou, Burkina Faso Bronze Medal in Panafrican Mathematics Olympiads (PAMO 2015), Abuja, Nigeria Certificate Bronze Medal in Panafrican Science Olympiads (PASO 2015), Abuja, Nigeria Certificate Best score in National College Certificate (Brevet d’études du premier cycle in french) 2013, Ouagadougou, Burkina Faso
Participation at the 18th International Conference on Network and Service Management (CNSM 2022) in Thessaloniki, Greece from October 31 - November 04, 2022.

Team MetaCD² got awards at the NeurIPS'22 competition track Cross-Domain MetaDL: Any-Way Any-Shot Learning Competition with Novel Datasets from Practical Domains presented in NeurIPS 2022 Competition Track.

Our workshop paper Assessing Unsupervised Machine Learning solutions for Anomaly Detection in Cloud Gaming got accepted at Workshop on High-Precision, Predictable, and Low-Latency Networking (HiPNet ‘22) colocated with 18th International Conference on Network and Service Management (CNSM), Thessaloniki, Greece, October 31 - November 4.

Participation and poster presentation at the 10th TMA PhD School colocated with Network Traffic Measurement and Analysis Conference (TMA) in Enschede, The Netherlands from June 27-30, 2022. Best Poster award for the poster presentation Characterization and troubleshooting of cloud gaming applications on mobile networks.

Participation in the days of the GDR RSD at Rennes, France and presentation entitled Protocol for measuring the transmission opportunities of a variable capacity network and its use from April 27-28, 2022.
Starting a PhD position (under CIFRE contract) between Orange Innovation and University of Lorraine.

item.title: Papers
item.description: Journal papers Conference/Workshop papers Posters Media articles (mentions or interviews) Internship reports Journal papers 📃 ML Models for Detecting QoE Degradation in Low-Latency Applications: A Cloud-Gaming Case Study Joël Roman Ky, Bertrand Mathieu, Abdelkader Lahmadi, Raouf Boutaba IEEE Transactions on Network and Service Management, Special Issue on Robust and Reliable Networks of the Future, 2023. Impact Factor: 5.3 (2023). DOI Paper Code 📃 An Analysis of Cloud Gaming Platforms Behaviour Under Synthetic Network Constraints and Real Cellular Networks Conditions

item.title: Experience
item.description: INRIA Nancy - Grand Est December 2024 - Now Research Engineer Villers-lès-Nancy, France Research engineer involved in PEPR Cloud - SPIREC project on anomaly detection and root cause analysis in Cloud-Edge-IoT continuum. Orange Innovation November 2021 - November 2024 PhD CIFRE - Research Engineer Lannion, France – Data science research project for enhancing the Quality of Experience (QoE) for low-latency applications within mobile and WiFi networks.

item.title: Education
item.description: ](/images/ut3.jpg)-- Doctor of Philosophy, Computer Science October 2021 - Now University of Lorraine Nancy, France Title : Automatic characterization, classification and troubleshooting of cloud gaming applications Doctoral School : IAEM - Lorraine Laboratory : LORIA Research Team : RESIST Supervisors : Isabelle CHRISMENT, Professor, University of Lorraine Raouf BOUTABA, Professor, University of Waterloo Abdelkader LAHMADI, Associate Professor, University of Lorraine Bertrand MATHIEU, Senior Researcher, Orange Innovation Master of Science, Computer Science September 2020 - September 2021

item.title: Skills
item.description: Coursework 📖 Computer Science 1. Software programming 2. Distributed programming 3. OS, Networks & Security 4. Web programming Machine Learning 1. Supervised Learning - Linear models - Support Vector Machines - Decisions Trees - Random Forests - Ensemble Learning 2. Unsupervised Learning - Clustering (K-means, Gaussian mixtures) - PCA (Linear, Kernel, Sparse) - Self-Organizing Maps Deep Learning 1. Neural Networks (ANN, DNN, CNN, RNN, GAN, Auto-Encoders) 2.

item.title: About
item.description: Bio Research interests News Professional Experience Education Awards Skills Bio Hello 👋, I am a PhD Candidate in Computer Science from University of Lorraine and an Engineer 🎓 graduated from Toulouse INP-ENSEEIHT in Computer Science and Telecommunications 💻. I did my preparatory classes at CPGE Mohamed V in Casablanca, Morocco. I went to a special high school, a military one 👮‍♂️, the Prytanée Militaire de Kadiogo.
